Spam has won the War

September 3rd, 2004 · 3 Comments

It’s a dark day for perham.net. Bob recently chose to forego his bob AT perham.net email address because it received nothing but spam. I have been getting about 500 emails per day to my mailbox, mike AT perham.net, with 10-20 of them legitimate. SpamAssassin catches about 90% of them but that still means that 2/3rds of the email I see in my inbox is spam.

So I’m giving up on my perham.net email address. I’m still running the spamassassin filter on it and forwarding anything sent directly to my email address that passes the filter to my new gmail account. But if you want to contact me going forward, I suggest just emailing mperham at gmail dot com.

Tags: Personal

  • 2 Raj // Sep 3, 2004 at 3:13 pm

    Don’t forget to check out the GMail Notifier - automatically puts an icon in your browser window if you get new mail to your Gmail account. Very handy and userful not to have to keep a gmail window open all the time and hit reload periodically.

    http://update.mozilla.org/extensions/moreinfo.php?id=173&vid=331&category=

    There’s also an extension to map mailto: urls to gmail - I haven’t used it yet so I don’t know how well it works but it might be worth checking out.

    As the source of your gmail invite, I demand royalties of 10 cents per email you receive.

  • 3 Rath // Sep 5, 2004 at 10:10 pm

    I’ve been wracking my brain, trying to figure out how 10% equals 2/3.
